title: Mayor Harrell kicks off One Seattle Day of Service
description:
View the City of Seattle's commenting policy: seattle.gov/online-comment-policy
Mayor Harrell kicks off the 2023 One Seattle Day of Service and joins nearly 4,000 volunteers to give back and take action to improve the city.

“The Day of Service is an opportunity to put our shared values of cooperation, inclusion, and unity into tangible action to improve our city,” said Mayor Harrell. “We are excited to see neighbors, local leaders, sports teams, small businesses, and community organizations come together and make Seattle a better place for everyone.”

Nearly 140 organizations are involved in the One Seattle Day of Service by either leading events, promoting events, or sending teams to volunteer at events. Partners include local sports teams like the Seattle Seahawks, Mariners, Sounders, OL Reign, and Sea Dragons; small businesses; neighborhood groups; local government leaders and staff; nonprofits and many, many more.

Speakers include:
Chris Woodward, Alliance for Pioneer Square
Lisa Howard, Alliance for Pioneer Square
Mayor Bruce Harrell, City of Seattle
David Young, COO, Seahawks and First and Goal
Maya Mendoza-Exstrom, Seattle Sounders
Michelle Haynes, OL Rain
Councilmember Andrew J. Lewis, Seattle City Council
